text: Joseph Lester "Jody" Powell, Jr. (September 30, 1943 â€“ September 14, 2009) was the White House Press Secretary during the presidency of Jimmy Carter from 1977 to 1981. Powell later co-founded a public relations firm. He was born in Cordele, Georgia. Powell died on September 14, 2009 of a heart attack in Cambridge, Maryland, aged 65. ==References== Category:1943 births Category:2009 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:White House Press Secretaries Category:Politicians from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Jody Powell
